name: coursera_bulk_search
description: Search multiple topics on Coursera in parallel using concurrent browser tabs. Use this instead of calling coursera_search multiple times - it is faster and more efficient. Pass all queries as a single comma-separated string.

parameters.name: queries
parameters.description: Comma-separated search queries (e.g. 'machine learning,data science,web development')

detailSteps.code: const results = []; const items = document.querySelectorAll('[data-testid="search-result"], [class*="result-card"], li[class*="ais-"], [class*="ProductCard"]'); for (let i = 0; i < Math.min(items.length, 5); i++) { const el = items[i]; const titleEl = el.querySelector('h3, h2, [class*="title"]'); const providerEl = el.querySelector('[class*="partner"], [class*="provider"]'); const ratingEl = el.querySelector('[class*="rating"] span'); const linkEl = el.querySelector('a[href*="/learn/"], a[href*="/specializations/"]'); results.push({ name: titleEl ? titleEl.textContent.trim() : '', provider: providerEl ? providerEl.textContent.trim() : '', rating: ratingEl ? ratingEl.textContent.trim() : '', url: linkEl ? linkEl.href : '' }); } const params = new URLSearchParams(window.location.search); return { query: params.get('query') || '', result_count: results.length, results: results }
detailSteps.name: search_results
detailSteps.label: Extract results
